text: Giovanni de Rosso (died 1493) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Alatri (1478–1493). (in Latin) ==Biography== On 14 Jan 1478, Giovanni de Rosso was appointed during the papacy of Pope Sixtus IV as Bishop of Alatri."Bishop Giovanni de Rosso" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved August 21, 2016 He served as Bishop of Alatri until his death in 1493. While bishop, he was the principal consecrator of Martin Johann Lintfari, Bishop of Žemaičiai (1492) . == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:15th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Sixtus IV Category:1493 deaths
title: Giovanni de Rosso
